content:
The ultra-nutshell version is that your natural mode of operation is wanting to love. This is the complete fulfilment of intelligent function in relationship to your life as it plays out in front of you. 

Self-image or our ego is a secondary carbon copy of this literal brain function that is the belief we are an actual "other" person in thought. This causes a secondary version of the previous emotion set that demands we create conditions under which other people love us. 

This is an introduction to self-inquiry, which is the question: "if you can see this, then how do you know other people love you other than your own invented standard?"
